intro: Paratrophis australiana, commonly known as the Australian paratrophis, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white or pink flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in a fine layer of white wax. Paratrophis australiana typically grows in sandy soils and is adapted to coastal conditions with salt spray and strong winds.
